column4: After failing to upgrade my system to Ubuntu 10.10, any action I take with apt-get gives me something like this: http://dpaste.org/CWUa/ .  How can I fix this?
sudo apt-get install -f    (tries to fix all broken packages)
sudo apt-get dist-upgrade might be useful too.  To try to finish the version upgrade.
You didn't read the pastebin : )  apt-get -f install is one of the commands that gives me that error.  Trying dist-upgrade, though I think it'll do the same thing.
Looks like dist-upgrade gives me that error, too.
Have you tried purging or reinstalling that troublesome package?
Packages, I think.  Way too many deps to do that.
Incidentally, that's the second thing I tried.  "E: Unmet dependencies. Try 'apt-get -f install' with no packages (or specify a solution)."
Trying to remove xulrunner tells me it's not installed.
no no, removing the package, all the dependencies, reinstalling everything
